018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.rest.model;
019
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.io.Serializable;
022import javax.servlet.ServletContext;
023import javax.xml.bind.annotation.XmlAttribute;
024import javax.xml.bind.annotation.XmlRootElement;
025import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.rest.ProtobufMessageHandler;
026import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.rest.RESTServlet;
027import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.rest.RestUtil;
028import org.apache.yetus.audience.InterfaceAudience;
029
030import org.apache.hbase.thirdparty.com.google.protobuf.CodedInputStream;
031import org.apache.hbase.thirdparty.com.google.protobuf.Message;
032import org.apache.hbase.thirdparty.org.glassfish.jersey.servlet.ServletContainer;
033
034import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.shaded.rest.protobuf.generated.VersionMessage.Version;
035
036/**
037 * A representation of the collection of versions of the REST gateway software components.
038 * <ul>
039 * <li>restVersion: REST gateway revision</li>
040 * <li>jvmVersion: the JVM vendor and version information</li>
041 * <li>osVersion: the OS type, version, and hardware architecture</li>
042 * <li>serverVersion: the name and version of the servlet container</li>
043 * <li>jerseyVersion: the version of the embedded Jersey framework</li>
044 * </ul>
045 */
046@XmlRootElement(name = "Version")
047@InterfaceAudience.Private
048public class VersionModel implements Serializable, ProtobufMessageHandler {
049
050  private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
051
052  private String restVersion;
053  private String jvmVersion;
054  private String osVersion;
055  private String serverVersion;
056  private String jerseyVersion;
057
058  /**
059   * Default constructor. Do not use.
060   */
061  public VersionModel() {
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Constructor
066   * @param context the servlet context
067   */
068  public VersionModel(ServletContext context) {
069    restVersion = RESTServlet.VERSION_STRING;
070    jvmVersion = System.getProperty("java.vm.vendor") + ' ' + System.getProperty("java.version")
071      + '-' + System.getProperty("java.vm.version");
072    osVersion = System.getProperty("os.name") + ' ' + System.getProperty("os.version") + ' '
073      + System.getProperty("os.arch");
074    serverVersion = context.getServerInfo();
075    jerseyVersion = ServletContainer.class.getPackage().getImplementationVersion();
076    // Currently, this will always be null because the manifest doesn't have any useful information
077    if (jerseyVersion == null) jerseyVersion = "";
078  }
079
080  /** Returns the REST gateway version */
081  @XmlAttribute(name = "REST")
082  public String getRESTVersion() {
083    return restVersion;
084  }
085
086  /** Returns the JVM vendor and version */
087  @XmlAttribute(name = "JVM")
088  public String getJVMVersion() {
089    return jvmVersion;
090  }
091
092  /** Returns the OS name, version, and hardware architecture */
093  @XmlAttribute(name = "OS")
094  public String getOSVersion() {
095    return osVersion;
096  }
097
098  /** Returns the servlet container version */
099  @XmlAttribute(name = "Server")
100  public String getServerVersion() {
101    return serverVersion;
102  }
103
104  /** Returns the version of the embedded Jersey framework */
105  @XmlAttribute(name = "Jersey")
106  public String getJerseyVersion() {
107    return jerseyVersion;
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * @param version the REST gateway version string
112   */
113  public void setRESTVersion(String version) {
114    this.restVersion = version;
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * @param version the OS version string
119   */
120  public void setOSVersion(String version) {
121    this.osVersion = version;
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * @param version the JVM version string
126   */
127  public void setJVMVersion(String version) {
128    this.jvmVersion = version;
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * @param version the servlet container version string
133   */
134  public void setServerVersion(String version) {
135    this.serverVersion = version;
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * @param version the Jersey framework version string
140   */
141  public void setJerseyVersion(String version) {
142    this.jerseyVersion = version;
143  }
144
145  /*
146   * (non-Javadoc)
147   * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
148   */
149  @Override
150  public String toString() {
151    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
152    sb.append("rest ");
153    sb.append(restVersion);
154    sb.append(" [JVM: ");
155    sb.append(jvmVersion);
156    sb.append("] [OS: ");
157    sb.append(osVersion);
158    sb.append("] [Server: ");
159    sb.append(serverVersion);
160    sb.append("] [Jersey: ");
161    sb.append(jerseyVersion);
162    sb.append("]\n");
163    return sb.toString();
164  }
165
166  @Override
167  public Message messageFromObject() {
168    Version.Builder builder = Version.newBuilder();
169    builder.setRestVersion(restVersion);
170    builder.setJvmVersion(jvmVersion);
171    builder.setOsVersion(osVersion);
172    builder.setServerVersion(serverVersion);
173    builder.setJerseyVersion(jerseyVersion);
174    return builder.build();
175  }
176
177  @Override
178  public ProtobufMessageHandler getObjectFromMessage(CodedInputStream cis) throws IOException {
179    Version.Builder builder = Version.newBuilder();
180    RestUtil.mergeFrom(builder, cis);
181    if (builder.hasRestVersion()) {
182      restVersion = builder.getRestVersion();
183    }
184    if (builder.hasJvmVersion()) {
185      jvmVersion = builder.getJvmVersion();
186    }
187    if (builder.hasOsVersion()) {
188      osVersion = builder.getOsVersion();
189    }
190    if (builder.hasServerVersion()) {
191      serverVersion = builder.getServerVersion();
192    }
193    if (builder.hasJerseyVersion()) {
194      jerseyVersion = builder.getJerseyVersion();
195    }
196    return this;
197  }
198}
